moves.1. c4 d5 2. cxd5: The Exchange variation. Can be boring and therefore drawish. For more interest, try 2. e3 or 2. Nf3.
moves.2... Nf6 3. Nc3 Nxd5 4. Nf3 Bg4: A Trompowski-type move, so I meet it as I do a Tromp-proper.
moves.5. g3 Bxf3 6. exf3 Nxc3 7. bxc3 Qd5 8. d: Queens gone, two pairs of minor pieces gone, neither side developed: this game seems destined to drift toward a lifeless draw.
moves.11... c5: ? -- This weakens b7 severely, and will come back to haunt Black shortly. Better Was 11. ...c6 which neither impedes Black's KB nor the Knight's eventual development to d7.
moves.12. Be3 Nd7 13. O-O Be7 14. Ra2: I've got a half-open file, so I may as well at least threaten to use it for something.
moves.14... a6 15. f4 Rb8 16. f5: ! -- Taking advantage of Black's weakness on his Q-side diagonals. Suddenly Black is in difficulty.
moves.22... Nc5 23. Rb6 Nxb7 24. Rxb7 Re7: Black wants to play ...Rc8 next, but it's too slow.
Brings down the curtain. But Black needs a little more convincing.

gameName: English -- Another Day at the Office-- Blitz Game
